command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.recordedfuture.com'; $user=$env:RF_USER; $key=$env:RF_PPK; $hostkey=$env:RF_HOSTKEY; $remote='/exports/domain_risk/daily/domain-risk-2025-09-30.json'; $dest='C:\Intel\RecordedFuture\domain-risk-2025-09-30.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Securely collects a paid closed-source domain risk feed from Recorded Future via SCP using PuTTY's pscp with key-based auth and host key pinning, then logs and outputs a JSON status.
rationale_steps: Authenticate to a subscription-only vendor endpoint using SSH key and pinned host key to avoid MITM.
Pull a specific daily JSON intelligence artifact with minimal noise (-batch, -q).
Hash the artifact for integrity and emit a structured JSON record for auditing.
Maintain compliance with closed-source information gathering by accessing a commercial feed.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, braces, and parentheses, proper variable assignments, error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, and correct cmdlet syntax throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by securely retrieving a paid threat intelligence feed from Recorded Future using proper authentication, logging the activity, and implementing error handling for operational reliability.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, exhibiting correct PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, external command execution, error handling, object creation, and file system operations, with balanced quotes and valid flags.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent of T1597 by securely acquiring a paid closed-source intelligence feed using appropriate tools (pscp), key-based authentication, and host key pinning, demonstrating a highly plausible operational implementation for intelligence collection.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced braces/quotes, valid separators, and correct pscp flag syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It aligns with T1597 by retrieving a paid closed-source feed via SCP with key-based auth and logging JSON, but assigning to the read-only automatic variable $Host ($host) will fail at runtime and prevent the intended operation.
